Chris Hughes is an experienced trainer and consultant with 11 years of regular British Army service and 5 years of experience as a contractor supporting collective training and intelligence capacity building.
He is also a serving Army Reservist (Major)

He has designed and delivered courses internationally, including for the Nigerian Armed Forces and the Chilean Centre for UN Peacekeeping Operations, and supported major UK exercises in ISR, CIMIC and Media/Information Operations roles and most recently supported NATO as JISR Manager on NATO
He is qualified in ISR, Human Security, Info Ops and experienced in analysis in academic, military and corporate contexts.
Holder of NATO SECRET security clearance (valid until 10/10/ 2033). Citizen of a NATO nation - UK
Analytical and dynamic trainer with a strong record of delivering complex training and advisory tasks under pressure on exercises and operations.
Experienced in NATO and UK Defence exercise environments in a variety of staff roles.
Deep understanding of intelligence processes, collection management, and human security within multinational contexts.
Skilled in research, analysis and presentation; capable of converting complex intelligence requirements into actionable outputs.
Experienced working with international organisations, including the UN and host-nation forces, fostering cooperation and trust.
Strong communication, stakeholder management and report-writing skills.
Experienced in EXCON, HICON and OPFOR.
Extensive experience in intelligence training design, exercise support and ISR consultancy across NATO and partner-nation contexts:
(Army Special Operations Brigade) Human Security, CIMIC, Gender and Security Force Assistance expertise in support of Army exercises.
JISR, Collection Manager for the NIFC/ INTEL section.
: Land Warfare Centre (UK), Ex HYPERION WARRIOR (British Army Special Operations Brigade Training), OPFOR INFOWAR (Info Ops/Media)
Nigeria, Contractor. Intelligence capacity building, designing and delivering Intelligence courses for Defence Intelligence College Abuja.
Germany, Contractor. Ex CERBERUS 24 (British Army Divisional training), OPFOR ISR Staff Officer.
UK, Student. Intermediate Command and Staff College (Land Reserve)
Land Warfare Center, Contractor. Ex LAND WARRIOR 23 (British Army Divisional Training), HICON CIMIC Staff Officer.
and Operations at the operational and strategic level during uniformed service;
2022, Op SCORPIUS (British Support to Ukraine during Russian invasion)
2019 Ex WARFIGHTER 19.4 - US Corps Level training event
2017 Ex WARFIGHTER 17.5 (Ft Bragg)- US Corps Level training event
2015 Ex IRON RESOLVE - British Divisional Training event
Proficient in the use of NATO Community of Interest Systems and tools such as JEMM, INTELFS.
Technical Skills - advanced MS Office user (Excel/VBA automation), familiar with ISR and intelligence software.
Human Security, CIMIC, Gender and Security Force Assistance expertise in support of Army exercises.
Oct 25: Contractor - JWC, Ex STDU25. JISR Collection Manager for the INTEL section.
Managed Collection requirement responses and analysts generating simulated products for training audiences as part of the INTEL team simulating NIFC.

Conducted a study for the Jordanian Public Security Directorate’s Anti-Narcotics Department on how UAS can support ISR operations. Led interviews, analysis and advisory outputs to inform future capability development.
Contractor, Land Warfare Centre (UK), Ex HYPERION WARRIOR (British Army Special Operations Brigade Training)
Planned and delivered OPFOR media and information operations to generate a realistic wrap for the training audience.
Delivered leadership and critical thinking training for the Nigerian Armed Forces. Designed and facilitated modules on human security, intelligence and leadership development.
Oct 24: Contractor, Germany. Ex CERBERUS 24 (British Army Divisional training), OPFOR ISR Staff Officer.
Staff Officer for OPFOR ISR conducting planning and operations for Operational level scenario to train 1(UK) Division.
Developed relationships across the UK Space sector, connecting industry, academia and local government to drive regional innovation.
Improved business processes and technology supporting sales teams across investment asset classes. Managed multiple concurrent projects and delivered automation solutions for efficiency.

Managed intelligence requirements during the invasion of Ukraine. Led a team of 25 analysts, developed a VBA-based automation tool streamlining Defence Intelligence’s task management RFI-IRM-CM workflow. Also lead the departments support to UKSF..
Changing Character of War Centre, University of Oxford
Conducted independent research into Venezuelan state information operations. Produced analysis integrating social media data, interviews and academic literature.
Planned and delivered training for mobile COVID-19 testing teams, managing scheduling and field operations.
Worked part time on a human terrain project with a reserve unit of UKSF.

Advised on political and military affairs across Latin America. Contributed to high-profile operations and represented the UK in defence diplomacy initiatives. Concurrently worked as lead human terrain analyst (Cultural Specialist) managing a team of analysts, QCing and contributing to products and writing reports.
UN Peacekeeping Instructor / Assistant Defence Attaché
Delivered UN peacekeeping courses, lectures and field training. Represented the UK in regional defence forums.

Directed 30+ ISR project teams from eight nations collecting intelligence in Afghanistan. Managed operations, training and personnel development for a 33-person team. Wrote and contributed to IMINT products.
Security Force Assistance Planners course, British Army, 2025
Cultural Property Protection Course, British Army, 2024
Intermediate Command and Staff Course, UK Ministry of Defence, 2024
Defence Human Security Course, UK Ministry of Defence, 2019
Cultural Specialist Course, UK Ministry of Defence, 2017
Spanish Language course, UK Ministry of Defence, 2015-16
Commissioning Course 111, Royal Military Academy Sandhurst, 2011
English native speaker, Spanish B2, French B1
Joint Commander’s Commendation for service on Op HERRICK (Afghanistan)
